Overall, Olaiya is one of the best places to go on the Mainland for good local food, especially swallow.

summary: Truffles Restaurant and Bar is a classy spot located in the heart of Ikeja. The interior has a ‘date night vibe with dark furniture and dim lights and the pricing is fairly reasonable. Their portions are also very generous as well as tasty and they have warm and attentive staff. All in all, if you are looking for a place in Ikeja to take bae/boo out on a friendly budget, Truffles is a solid option.
tag: lounge, platter, date night, casual dining, budget friendly, budget: 15000 per person, mainland, on the mainland, located on the island: false, located on the mainland: true, Ikeja

address: No. 60 Isaac John St, Ikeja GRA, Ikeja, Lagos
summary: Zen Gardenis a Chinese restaurant located in the heart of Ikeja with a well designed and crafted interior space. They are a very attractive option for Chinese Food on the mainland with their decently sized portions. The ambience is decent although not particularly memorable but the staff are very attentive and effective. Overall, Zen Garden is a very solid option, perhaps even for date night, on the mainland that has a budget friendly Chinese menu
tag: Korean, Chinese, lounge, Asian cuisine, dumplings, dim sum, great ambience, great for group outings, budget friendly, date night, budget: 15000 per person, on the mainland, mainland, not on the island, on the island: false, on the mainland: true

address: 3A Tokunbo Omisore Street, Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
summary: Quays Lagos (pronounced Keys as they are quick to let us know) is one of the few restaurants in Lagos that set out to shape their theme around being gluten free. It has a delightful ambience which is beautifully and tastefully decorated. While a bit pricey, the quality of the food provided makes it worth it and we heartily recommend a visit.
tag: great ambience, fine dining, date night, gluten free, elite restaurant, budget: 25000 per person, on the island, island, not on the mainland, located on the island: true, lekki, located on the mainland: false

address: 33 Fola Osibo Rd, Eti-Osa, Lekki, Lagos
summary: Jollof by Jara is a West African themed restaurant with a diverse traditional Nigerian menu despite what the name might otherwise suggest. They also have soups, brunch options and a useful kids menu. Jollof by Jara restaurant is a great option for date nights, family celebrations, group dates, and corporate lunches.  Overall, Jollof by Jara combines affordable, quality indulgence with a family focus and attention to detail, especially for those who seek an authentic West-African-themed dining experience in a serene environment.
tag: casual dining, family friendly, great for kids, budget friendly, jollof, brunch, local food, Nigerian food, corporate lunch, budget: 15000 per person, on the island, island, not on the mainland, located on the island: true, lekki, located on the mainland: false

address: 7B Karimu Kotun St, Victoria Island, Lagos
summary: Talindo Steakhouse as the name suggests is all about the steak. An elegant and well-run steakhouse hiding in plain sight with a wonderful and well-crafted ambience. We recommend their Jack Daniel’s Steak which is a Signature dish. The waiters were also very prompt and professional. While Talindo is on the high side in terms of price, it offers a premium experience which is great for date night and is worth taking your millions.
tag: fine dining, steakhouse, date night, expensive, burgers, steak, on the island, island, not on the mainland, located on the island: true, lekki, located on the mainland: false, budget: 30000 per person, Victoria Island, VI

address: 864a Bishop Aboyade Cole St, Victoria Island 106104, Lagos
summary: Eric Kayser is one of the most Instagram friendly restaurants in Lagos and the food isn’t half bad either. They offer a wide range of pastry options and are one of the best places you could go for brunch and ice cream. The service is great and timely and their pasta options also pack a pretty punch in terms of taste and their dessert options are just as solid. Overall, if you are looking for a budget friendly place on the island with great ambience where you can take those popping pictures for Instagram as well as have solid pastry, pasta and dessert options, Eric Kayser is a strong contender.
tag: great pastry, great for pictures, great ambience, budget friendly, casual dining, brunch, pasta, dessert, breakfast, sandwiches, cafe to work from, budget: 15000 per person, on the island, island, not on the mainland, located on the island: true, lekki, located on the mainland: false,

address: 12A Akin Olugbade St, Victoria Island 106104, Lagos
summary: NOK by Alara is well known for its gourmet take on traditional Nigerian and African food in general. They provide a pleasant ambience with efficient and cheerful service. Their amala is one of their popular options and although it is priced above what will typically be found in the bukas on the mainland, it’s quite tasty in itself. They do also offer other options however ranging from mac and cheese to pancakes but we definitely think their strong suit is local food. All in all, if you are looking for a place that’s fairly budget friendly on the island and want good local food, Nok is worth a visit.
tag: amala, local food, Nigerian food, swallow, budget friendly, on the island, island, not on the mainland, located on the island: true, lekki, located on the mainland: false,budget: 12000 per person

address: 282 Herbert Macaulay Way, Yaba, Lagos
summary: The illustrious burger franchise is now in Nigeria and they’re making a statement. With a pleasant and surprisingly spacious interior and prompt quick staff, Burger King is a great option if you are looking for budget friendly burgers. They also offer a lot of really nice side options  ranging from ice cream to brownies to nuggets and milkshake. Overall, we definitely recommend Burger King if you are looking for a budget friendly place selling burgers with a clean ambience.
tag: burger, budget friendly, milkshakes, ice cream,budget: 5000 per person, yaba, on the mainland, mainland, not on the island, on the island: false, on the mainland: true, budget: 5000 per person

address: 45c Sobo Arobiodu St, Ikeja GRA, Ikeja, Lagos
summary: Hua Han Korean/Chinese restaurant is located in the heart of Ikeja and can be a tad difficult to get to however. That said, they are a very attractive option for Korean food on the mainland with their decently sized portions. The ambience is decent although not particularly memorable but the staff are very attentive and effective. If you are interested in giving Korean cuisine a try, then Hua Han is definitely worth a try.
tag: Korean, Chinese, lounge, Asian cuisine, budget friendly, BBQ platter, budget: 15000 per person, on the mainland, mainland, not on the island, on the island: false, on the mainland: true, ikeja

address: 50 Oguntolu St, Somolu 102216, Lagos
summary: Amoke Oge is one of the core buka options around the Somolu axis. They offer a great variety of traditional food ranging from swallow to jollof. I think the star of the show however is their jollof with the moi moi and whatever form of protein your choice is. Ambience is not to be expected in such a place and perhaps for good reason- it is a buka. Service is prompt once you get past the queue. Overall, Amoke Oge is one of the best places to go on the Mainland for good local food, especially their jollof rice and swallow.
tag: budget friendly, swallow, amala, pounded yam, value for money, ewedu, gbegiri, buka, street food, jollof rice, budget: 1500 per person, located on the mainland: true, located on the island: false,budget friendly, location: on the mainland, not on the island,

address: Ikeja City Mall, Obafemi Awolowo Way, Oregun, Ikeja
summary: Casper and Gambini’s is one of the OG restaurants in Lagos. With a beautiful and serene ambience, it is one of the best value places to go to on the mainland. The wait time was a bit long however but the food quality more than made up for it. There's also an outdoor seating area and they are a great option for kids. Overall, if you're looking for a decent restaurant on the mainland with nice meal options and great for groups, Casper and Gambini’s is worth looking into
tag: casual dining, family friendly, great for kids,.budget friendly, good for dates, brunch, great for groups,  on the mainland, mainland, not on the island, on the island: false, on the mainland: true, budget: 20000 per person

address: Ibiyinka Olorunbe Close, off Amodu Ojikutu Street, Victoria Island
summary: Ci Gusta Lagos is a restaurant with a beautiful and inviting interior decor. The menu offers a variety of Italian dishes, including pizza, pasta, and gelato. The food is well-prepared and tasty, and the portion sizes are generous. The service is also prompt and friendly. However, the prices are on the high side, and the outdoor seating area is not very comfortable. They do a great job with their delicious fresh pastries but their pasta is a bit of a down point. Overall, if you are looking for a nice Italian restaurant with good food and service, Ci Gusta Lagos is worth a visit.
tag: coffee shop,very expensive,clean and open interior. great for salads, delicious fresh pastry, average pasta, italian restaurant, casual, brunch, budget: 30000 per person, location: island. located on the island: true, located on the mainland: false

address: 7 Musa Yar’adua Street, Victoria Island
summary: Cilantro Indian Restaurant has lovely decor and the seating arrangement is quite comfortable.They have quite a spacious outdoor space and we loved the views. The food was also great and we especially loved the mozzarella naan which is something you must try. The chicken tikka masala was very rich with flavor and the soups were enjoyable. The service was decent, but the wait time for the food was a bit too long. Overall, Cilantro is one of the best value restaurants in Lagos with their generous portions and great outdoor seating.
tag: indian,Great value for money, large portions, pleasant ambience, great outdoor dining, mozzarella naan, generous portions, continental dishes, casual, budget friendly, budget: 12000 per person, location: island. located on the island: true, located on the mainland: false

address: 48 Balarabe Musa Crescent, Victoria Island 23401, Lagos
summary: La Taverna is an Italian themed restaurant which offers tasty and flavourful meals with the nice cozy ambience reminiscent of a small restaurant in an Italian village.Their pricing is fairly reasonable and they have budget days like pizza Wednesday and pasta Thursday where they offer discounts. The service was prompt and the waiters were courteous. We definitely recommend checking out La Taverna if you are looking for budget options for pasta or pizza on the island.
tag: pasta, pizza, salads, soups, tacos, budget friendly, Italian restaurant, budget: 15000 per person, Victoria Island, VI, location: island. located on the island: true, located on the mainland: false

address: 16 Akin Adesola St, Victoria Island, Lagos
summary: Cafeteria is a great breakfast/brunch option with reasonable pricing. The space is a bit small however so it might not be ideal for groups. Their menu options range from pancakes to omelettes and while the service can be slow and be a bit disorderly, the food does make up for it. There’s not much to note about the ambience but if you are looking for a place where you can have waffles, pancakes or other breakfast options with a friend, Cafeteria is worth going to.
tag: brunch, breakfast, omelette, casual dining, great restaurant, budget friendly, bubble tea, pancakes, toast, budget: 15,000 per person, location: island. located on the island: true, located on the mainland: false

address: 134 Ahmadu Bello Way, beside Silverbird Cinemas, Victoria Island, Lagos
summary: Sabor Lagos has a trendy and cool ambience, with a cozy indoor seating area and a calm outdoor space. The key being Sabor is solid- not too many memorable moments but they certainly do a lot of things right. The service was timely and the waiters were respectful and knowledgeable. Ultimately, Sabor Lagos does a good job at ticking all the right notes and we definitely feel they are worth you sliding your ATM card into their POS.
tag: casual dining, crab fritters, chicken lollipop, burgers, budget: 20000 per person, location: island. located on the island: true, located on the mainland: false, Victoria Island, VI

address: Novare Mall, Sangotedo Lekki-Epe Expressway Lekki, Lagos
summary: Panarottis Pizza is the best in Lagos you have not had yet. It is a family restaurant that serves the best Italian food with excellent specials and play area facilities for kids. Their pizza as well as pasta options are great on the pocket and even better in your mouth. Service time is about average and the staff are very friendly. Overall, if you are looking for a cheap place for pasta and pizza in Ajah, you would do well to find a spot better than Panarottis.
tag: great pizza, pasta, budget friendly, casual dining, value for money, budget: 5000 per person, location: island. located on the island: true, located on the mainland: false
